home.title: Experimental Farms Management System
home.description: Open-source web platform helping the Louvain-la-Neuve experimental farm stay compliant while tracking every parcel and sub-plot over time.

hero.title: Plan, document and report every square meter with confidence.
hero.subtitle: EFMS centralizes field histories, experiments and regulatory exports so agronomists, researchers and staff can collaborate without spreadsheets.

context.title: Context
context.heading: Why the farm needed EFMS
context.description: Belgian farms must provide a yearly declaration for each cultivated surface. The LLN experimental farm further subdivides fields into small research parcels, multiplying the paperwork and the risk of inconsistencies.

project.title: Project
project.heading: Co-designed with LLN teams
project.description: This thesis delivers a maintainable, open-source GIS-like web application co-designed with the farm's team to record, visualize and retrieve operations while remaining compatible with official tools.

items.title: Precise parcel editor
items.description: Draw, split and color-code main fields plus experimental sub-parcels with overlap detection.

items.title: Complete agronomic logbook
items.description: Record crops, treatments, experiments and yearly operations per zone with a full audit trail.

items.title: Regulation-ready exports
items.description: Generate reports compatible with Belgian administrative systems and research workflows.

items.title: Historical timeline
items.description: Travel through seasons to understand what happened on any square meter in seconds.

items.title: Collaboration-first UI
items.description: Role-friendly interface that stays fast on the field and intuitive in the office.

timeline.title: Example usage
timeline.lead: The LLN experimental farm nests operations from official parcels down to experiment-specific zones so compliance data always reflects on-field work.

items.title: Main parcels
items.description: Two official declarations (Blue and Black) frame the compliance perimeter.

items.title: Nested zones
items.description: Within the Black parcel, specific Purple/Blue/Red sub-plots capture crop tests and localized treatments.

items.title: Traceable actions
items.description: Each zone stores its own operations history, ensuring declarations remain accurate down to the meter.

cta.title: Ready to try it?
cta.description: Start by drawing your farm or jump straight to the interactive map to explore existing parcels.

mapTutorial.title: Interactive map tutorial
mapTutorial.intro: Use this guided workflow to draw experimental parcels, edit them safely and keep your data organized.

sections.title: 1. Prepare the workspace
sections.body: Before drawing, make sure you are authenticated and that the right farm is selected in the navigation bar.
actions: Choose a farm with the selector next to your profile picture. This loads its polygons and color palette.
Press the map link in the navbar to open the editor.
Wait for the base map to finish loading (spinner in the right panel).

sections.title: 2. Create a polygon
sections.body: Draw experimental parcels by placing vertices on the imagery layer.
actions: Click the "Add" button in the left toolbar, then select "Polygon".
Left-click on the map to drop each vertex. Use scroll to zoom for higher precision.
Close the polygon by clicking on the first vertex or by pressing Enter to auto-complete.
Give the parcel a name in the modal that appears and confirm to save it.

sections.title: 3. Edit an existing polygon
actions: Select the polygon either from the list or by clicking it on the map.
Use the toolbar action "Edit" to expose draggable vertices.
Drag handles to new positions; double-click to insert a new vertex, press Delete to remove one.
Hit "Save" when you are satisfied or "Cancel" to revert changes.

sections.title: 4. Manage visibility & colors
sections.body: Keep the view readable by toggling polygons on and off and applying semantic colors.
actions: Open the polygon list on the right and use the checkbox to show or hide a parcel.
Click the colored dot to choose a new hue that matches crops or experiment types.
Group related sub-parcels by assigning the same color family.

sections.title: 5. Delete or duplicate
sections.body: Clean up prototypes or reuse shapes for faster data entry.
actions: Use the three-dot menu on a polygon to duplicate it and tweak the copy.
Select "Delete" to remove a parcel. You will be asked to confirm to avoid accidental loss.
When deleting, EFMS keeps the historical log but removes it from the live map.

tips.title: Field-tested tips
items: Combine satellite imagery with cadastral overlays (layer button) for centimeter-level accuracy.
Name polygons with a consistent convention such as FIELD-PLOT-SUBPLOT (e.g., B1-Red-2025).
Refresh the map after long editing sessions by pressing R to ensure overlapping checks rerun.

items.description: Cancel the current drawing or exit edit mode.
Finish drawing and open the naming modal.
Undo the last vertex while drawing.
